description: Configure advanced settings for HTTPS Inspection.

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Send JSON object to use the API Web Services

headers.name: X-chkp-sid
headers.description: Session unique identifier as it returned by the login request

body.name: bypass-on-client-failure
body.description: Whether all requests should be bypassed or blocked-in case of client errors (Client closes the connection due to authentication issues during handshake)true - Fail-open (bypass all requests).false - Fail-close (block all requests.The default value is true.

body.name: bypass-on-failure
body.description: Whether all requests should be bypassed or blocked-in case of server errors (for example validation error during GW-Server authentication)true - Fail-open (bypass all requests).false - Fail-close (block all requests.The default value is true.

body.name: track
body.description: Whether to log and send a notification for the bypass under load:None - Does not record the event.Log - Records the event details. Use SmartConsole or SmartView to see the logs.Alert - Logs the event and executes a command you configured.Mail - Sends an email to the administrator.SNMP Trap - Sends an SNMP alert to the configured SNMP Management Server.User Defined Alert - Sends a custom alert..

body.name: site-categorization-allow-mode
body.description: Whether all requests should be allowed or blocked until categorization is complete.Background - to allow requests until categorization is complete.Hold- to block requests until categorization is complete.The default value is hold.

body.name: block-expired
body.description: Set to be true in order to drop traffic from servers with expired server certificate.

body.name: block-revoked
body.description: Set to be true in order to drop traffic from servers with revoked server certificate (validate CRL).

body.name: block-untrusted
body.description: Set to be true in order to drop traffic from servers with untrusted server certificate.

body.name: track-errors
body.description: Whether to log and send a notification for the server validation errors:None - Does not record the event.Log - Records the event details in SmartView.Alert - Logs the event and executes a command.Mail - Sends an email to the administrator.SNMP Trap - Sends an SNMP alert to the SNMP GU.User Defined Alert - Sends customized alerts..

body.name: retrieve-intermediate-ca-certificates
body.description: Configure the value "true" to use the "Certificate Authority Information Access" extension to retrieve certificates that are missing from the certificate chain.The default value is true.

body.name: name
body.description: Describes the name, cannot be overridden.

body.name: cert-serial-number
body.description: Certificate Serial Number (unique) in hexadecimal format HH:HH.

body.name: comments
body.description: Describes the certificate by default, can be overridden by any text.

body.name: name
body.description: Describes the name, cannot be overridden.

body.name: cert-serial-number
body.description: Certificate Serial Number (unique) in hexadecimal format HH:HH.

body.name: comments
body.description: Describes the certificate by default, can be overridden by any text.

body.name: remove
body.description: Removes from collection of values

body.name: name
body.description: Describes the name, cannot be overridden.

body.name: cert-serial-number
body.description: Certificate Serial Number (unique) in hexadecimal format HH:HH.

body.name: comments
body.description: Describes the certificate by default, can be overridden by any text.

body.name: name
body.description: Describes the name, cannot be overridden.

body.name: cert-serial-number
body.description: Certificate Serial Number (unique) in hexadecimal format HH:HH.

body.name: comments
body.description: Describes the certificate by default, can be overridden by any text.

body.name: name
body.description: Describes the name, cannot be overridden.

body.name: cert-serial-number
body.description: Certificate Serial Number (unique) in hexadecimal format HH:HH.

body.name: comments
body.description: Describes the certificate by default, can be overridden by any text.

body.name: blocked-certificate-tracking
body.description: Controls whether to log and send a notification for dropped traffic.None - Does not record the event.Log - Records the event details in SmartView.Alert - Logs the event and executes a command.Mail - Sends an email to the administrator.SNMP Trap - Sends an SNMP alert to the SNMP GU.User Defined Alert - Sends customized alerts..

body.name: bypass-update-services
body.description: Configure the value "true" to bypass traffic to well-known software update services.The default value is true.

body.name: certificate-pinned-apps-action
body.description: Configure the value "bypass" to bypass traffic from certificate-pinned applications approved by Check Point.HTTPS Inspection cannot inspect connections initiated by certificate-pinned applications.Configure the value "detect" to send logs for traffic from certificate-pinned applications approved by Check Point.The default value is bypass.

body.name: log-sessions
body.description: The value "true" configures the Security Gateway to send HTTPS Inspection session logs.The default value is true.

success.name: bypass-on-client-failure
success.description: Whether all requests should be bypassed or blocked-in case of client errors (Client closes the connection due to authentication issues during handshake)true - Fail-open (bypass all requests).false - Fail-close (block all requests..

success.name: bypass-on-failure
success.description: Whether all requests should be bypassed or blocked-in case of server errors (for example validation error during GW-Server authentication)true - Fail-open (bypass all requests).false - Fail-close (block all requests..

success.name: track
success.description: Whether to log and send a notification for the bypass under load:None - Does not record the event.Log - Records the event details. Use SmartConsole or SmartView to see the logs.Alert - Logs the event and executes a command you configured.Mail - Sends an email to the administrator.SNMP Trap - Sends an SNMP alert to the configured SNMP Management Server.User Defined Alert - Sends a custom alert..

success.name: site-categorization-allow-mode
success.description: Whether all requests should be allowed or blocked until categorization is complete.Background - to allow requests until categorization is complete.Hold- to block requests until categorization is complete..

success.name: block-revoked

success.name: block-untrusted

success.name: track-errors
success.description: Whether to log and send a notification for the server validation errors:None - Does not record the event.Log - Records the event details in SmartView.Alert - Logs the event and executes a command.Mail - Sends an email to the administrator.SNMP Trap - Sends an SNMP alert to the SNMP GU.User Defined Alert - Sends customized alerts..

success.name: retrieve-intermediate-ca-certificates
success.description: Configure the value "true" to use the "Certificate Authority Information Access" extension to retrieve certificates that are missing from the certificate chain.

success.name: name
success.description: Describes the name, cannot be overridden.

success.name: cert-serial-number
success.description: Certificate Serial Number (unique) in hexadecimal format HH:HH.

success.name: comments
success.description: Describes the certificate by default, can be overridden by any text.

success.name: blocked-certificate-tracking
success.description: Controls whether to log and send a notification for dropped traffic.None - Does not record the event.Log - Records the event details in SmartView.Alert - Logs the event and executes a command.Mail - Sends an email to the administrator.SNMP Trap - Sends an SNMP alert to the SNMP GU.User Defined Alert - Sends customized alerts..

success.name: bypass-update-services
success.description: Configure the value "true" to bypass traffic to well-known software update services.

success.name: certificate-pinned-apps-action
success.description: Configure the value "bypass" to bypass traffic from certificate-pinned applications approved by Check Point.HTTPS Inspection cannot inspect connections initiated by certificate-pinned applications.Configure the value "detect" to send logs for traffic from certificate-pinned applications approved by Check Point.

success.name: log-sessions

failure.name: current-session
failure.description: Validation related to the current session.

failure.name: current-session
failure.description: Validation related to the current session.

failure.name: current-session
failure.description: Validation related to the current session.

set-https-advanced-settings.request:
POST {{server}}/set-https-advanced-settings
Content-Type: application/json
X-chkp-sid: {{session}}

{
  "bypass-on-failure" : "false",
  "bypass-on-client-failure" : "false",
  "bypass-under-load.track" : "log",
  "site-categorization-allow-mode" : "background",
  "server-certificate-validation-actions.block-untrusted" : "true",
  "server-certificate-validation-actions.block-revoked" : "false",
  "server-certificate-validation-actions.block-expired" : "true",
  "blocked-certificate-tracking" : "popup alert",
  "bypass-update-services" : "true",
  "certificate-pinned-apps-action" : "bypass",
  "log-sessions" : "true",
  "retrieve-intermediate-ca-certificates" : "true",
  "server-certificate-validation-actions.track-errors" : "snmp trap alert"
}
